fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Sport, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication, Banking and financial services
inter_groups: Follow and work with the EP's committees relevant to our activities (AFET, DROI, LIBE)
eu_initiatives:
- The EAFJD follows Turkey's accession process to the EU, making sure that the Armenian Genocide recognition is properly included in the negotiations. 
- The EAFJD also follows all issues in the South Caucasus - Armenia, Azerbaijan, Georgia - mainly energy, security, defense and lasting peace in the region, specifically in regards to the conflict of Nagorno Karabakh - Artsakh. 
- The EAFJD also follows the Euronest Parliamentary Assembly activities, and were present in the last plenary session in Yerevan. 
- The EAFJD also works in preserving the Armenian culture, mainly the Western Armenian language, which is spoken in the Diaspora and is in decline, in the last years.
organisation_name: Fédération Euro-Arménienne pour la Justice et la Démocratie (EAFJD)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication: EAFJD's activities in the last years were centered around the Centennial of the Armenian Genocide, and we have realized many projects in this regard. Projects include the 4th European - Armenian Convention in the European Parliament, Brussels, planned for October 2017, conferences, film screenings, publications (on Nagorno Karabakh and the Armenian Genocide).
goals__remit: The European Armenian Federation for Justice & Democracy (EAFJD) is the umbrella organization of the Armenian National Committees in European countries. The EAFJD is the main interlocutor of European citizens of Armenian origin to the EU institutions - working on a better understanding of Armenia and Armenians in the EU and of the EU in Armenia. The European Armenian Federation also advocates for the rights of the Armenian Diaspora in Europe, and the rights of the Armenian minority in Turkey, and in the South Caucasus.
